peopleAlsoAsk.question: What does an art appraisal cost?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Art appraisers may adjust their hourly rate depending on the scope of the appraisal assignment, but on average you should expect to pay between $150-$500 per hour for a USPAP-compliant art appraisal.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How much does it cost to get art appraised?

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I find out what my art is worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Consider finding an appraiser to determine the value of your artwork. Appraisers are trained specialists who work for a fee. They evaluate your piece and give you a written statement of its value.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How Much Is Your Object Worth? | Smithsonian American Art Museum

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much does an art valuation cost?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The certificate of valuation costs $250 (including GST) for the first artwork, with each additional original painting valued at $125.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Hart Art Valuations & Appraisals - David Hart Galleries

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I get my artwork valued?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: If the name is not clear you may need to use a professional dealer or auction house to attribute the artwork. If you suspect that your picture is valuable, take it to a specialist fine art auctioneer, such as Bonham's, Christie's or Sotheby's. Bonham's has offices in cities around the UK.
